events.name: Productivity Workshop: Test-Driven Development Part II
events.description:
TDD is a software development approach where a feature is built incrementally through the repetition of very short development cycles. In this approach, the process is started by turning a requirement into a specific test case, then code is written to pass the test, and then the cycle is repeated by adding a test for another feature requirement. Benefits of TDD include faster feedback, reduced scope creep and over-engineering, and modular and maintainable code.
In this workshop, you will learn TDD practices and how to implement this approach in your own projects.
MEET THE PEOPLE



Nathaniel Currier
Director, Engineering - Temasys Communications
Speaker


With an extensive background in both the technical and creative landscapes and nearly a decade of experience in cloud computing, Nathaniel brings unique insights into effective product development and scaling. Nathaniel has worked with with some of the world’s most prominent and successful brands across the United States, Europe and Asia throughout his career including McgarryBowen, Marriott, Nokia, Samsung, Google, General Motors, RedBull, Spotify, and MTV/Viacom. 
RESERVING A SEAT

Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: ProductTank #11: Career Development
events.description:
Speaker: Graham Kennedy, Director of Product Management at Zendesk Singapore Topic: ​Lessons learned (read failures encountered) leading high performing product management teams and practical tips to tackle common product leadership challenges​. About Graham Graham loves to build things that matter for people who matter. For the past 12 years he's been a product manager, ScrumMaster, and is now the Director of Product Management at Zendesk Chat in Singapore. Graham's a fervent supporter of lean product development and always favors experiments over experiences. In the second half of the event we are going to have a panel discussion with the topic "My first year as a Product Manager". 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank & a few words from the host. 19:05 - 19:35 - Speaker talk + Q&A 19:35 - 19:50 - Networking break 19:50 - 20:30 - Panel discussion + Q&A 20:30 - 21:00 - More networking 21:00 - Event ends Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm • Remember to bring your ID, just in case :) • IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break About location HomeAway have kindly offered to host this meetup, their address is: UE Square Level 17, 83 Clemenceau Avenue, Singapore,[masked]
events.location: HomeAway, 83 Clemenceau Ave, UE Square #17-05, Singapore

events.name: PyData Meetup - August 2017
events.description: Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:00pm Presentation:   Working with Social Network Data: Promises and Pitfalls by Prasanta Bhattacharya "Social networks are everywhere and have fascinated researchers for many centuries. Now, with the proliferation of internet-based platforms and big data, the systematic treatment of online social networks is steadily gaining importance. This talk would introduce the audience to social network datasets, and help define and characterize the different types of data that get generated on such platforms. We will talk about ways to acquire, store, visualize and analyze such types of data for predictive analytics as well as causal inferencing, with a special focus on data complexities and challenges that are common in such networked contexts. Wherever relevant, code snippets and common tools will be demonstrated." Prasanta Bhattacharya holds a Ph.D in Information Systems from the Department of Information Systems and Analytics, National University of Singapore, where he studied computational social science. His broader research agenda focuses on the interplay between an individual's online and offline behaviour in specific contexts (e.g. social media, search engines etc.). He is currently working as a Scientist with the Social Intelligence group at the Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) where he works on behavioural analytics.  • 8:00pm - 9:00pm Presentation: Updates •  Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors • O'REILLY MEDIA INC.  • Engineers.SG  • NumFocus
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117371

events.name: Bootcamp: Learn How to Build a Bookstore WebApp With Ruby on Rails - 15th Aug
events.description: We are teaching a free programming lesson for new beginners on how to build a bookstore web application with Ruby on Rails. At the end of 2 hours, you will learn how to set up a book store web application, deploy it to a live website and show off to your peers! For this lesson, you must bring along your own computer (any system) and be prepared to learn how to write code and build websites! There are no other prerequisites. Don't have a computer? Pm me and I will bring one more for you. Spaces are limited for only 30 students.  Due to popular demand and space constraints, we will hold another class on the 17th!
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: Xamarin For Beginners Part I of IV : Introduction to Xamarin - Hands On
events.description: Xamarin For Beginners Part I of IV : Introduction to Xamarin This is the first Hands-on Session out of 4 that will to cover the basics of Developing cross platform applications with Xamarin aimed at a beginner audience. Knowledge of C# would help a bit. This first session will cover Xamarin basics such as the platform overview, development environment, project structure, and a good old hello world or two. IMPORTANT: Before attending, please setup Xamarin on your device (and insure your device is fully charged): Mac: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/mac/installation Windows: https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/android/getting_started/installation/windows/#installation
